column4: is there any way to temporarily revert to the Open Source nvidia driver? I cant start x!
put Driver "nv" in your Device section in /etc/X11/xorg.conf
still won't start :( "No devices detected"
you sure you have an nvidia card there. pastebin the entire xorg.conf
ubottu: I have 2 x 8800GTS's in SLI lol, I cant pastebin, running IRC using irssi from a terminal
sudo apt-get install pastebinit
cat /etc/X11/xorg.conf | pastebinit -
http://www.pastebin.com/f6a0a6597
says unknown post id, you sure you got the address correct
double checked it; http://pastebin.com/f6a0a6597
reposted: http://pastebin.com/f4e1f5f31
hm looks fine. maybe nv doesnt support SLI
:\ tried the proprietary drivers through packages & nvidias site, everything was fine under Hardy, but interepid shits itself
the latest drivers from nvidia.com? did you uninstall drivers that came with ubuntu?
yep, latest from NVIDIA's site - how do I uninstall the existing drivers?
I used apt-get remove nvidia-glx-180
open synaptic and pretty much delete all things nvidia, except nv driver, and modaliases packages
there also should be nvidia-uninstall utility that came with drivers from nvidia.com
make sure you have linux-headers package corresponding to the kernel you're running before reinstalling the driver
how do I determine the running kernel version?
uname -a
